definition: to be appropriate to have with alcohol/to down one's drink
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
a dish that goes well with alcoholic drinks

sentences.english: If memories of drinks, would rather get drunk.
sentences.chinese: 回忆若能下酒，宁愿一醉方休。

sentences.english: Every time before he killed a cow, he cut out its tongue and ate it with liquor.
sentences.chinese: 每次他杀牛之前，他都会把牛的舌头割下来下酒。

sentences.english: Would you like anythellong to go with your drinks?
sentences.chinese: 你想要端啥子菜下酒吗？

sentences.english: what kind of snacks should we have?
Mom has bought some fennel beans for Dad to go with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈买了茴香豆给爸爸做下酒菜。

sentences.english: Not to mention the perfect pal for your drinking needs is not far from a pork and kimchi stir-fry.
sentences.chinese: 当然用蛋包配上泡菜炒猪肉绝对是下酒菜的新宠儿。

sentences.english: He likes accompanying wine with beef tendons.
sentences.chinese: 他喝酒的时候喜欢拿牛筋当下酒菜。

sentences.english: They cooked these and served them with liquor.
sentences.chinese: 他们把这些炒了当下酒菜。

sentences.english: Pickling and drying the shadow to go with wine when you grow old.
sentences.chinese: 把影子，腌起来，风干，老的时候，下酒。

sentences.english: What kind of snack should we have?
He cut out the cows' tongues to eat with his liquor, because he liked the taste.
sentences.chinese: 他把牛舌头割下来下酒，就是因为喜欢吃。

sentences.english: Waits the fresh sliced meat to turn whitematurely then bails out dips the seasoning to drink edible.
sentences.chinese: 待鲜肉片已发白成熟即可捞出蘸佐料下酒食用。

sentences.english: Will your shadow dry, to the old when used with wine.
sentences.chinese: 将妳旳影子风干，到老旳时候拿来下酒。

definition: a dish that goes well with alcoholic drinks
to drink together (in company)/to drink together (with food)
appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
salad with dressing/cold vegetables dressed with sauce (e.g. coleslaw)
food and drink/food to accompany wine
